questions.question: What is the ratio of Brake Power to Indicated Power called?

explanations.a: The ratio of Brake Power to Indicated Power is called Mechanical Efficiency.
explanations.b: It is the ratio of indicated power to the product of  total fuel consumption and calorific value.
explanations.c: The ratio of total swept volume to total compressed volume  is compression ratio.
explanations.d: The ratio of total fuel consumption to the fuel power is BSFC

questions.question: What is the Brake Specific Fuel Consumption (BSFC) of an engine with a Brake Power of 20 kW and consumes fuel at a rate of 0.4 kg/h?

explanations.a: BSFC = Fuel Consumption (kg/h) / Brake Power (kW) = 0.4 kg/h / 20 kW = 0.025 kg/kWh
explanations.b: BSFC = Fuel Consumption (kg/h) / Brake Power (kW) = 0.4 kg/h / 20 kW = 0.025 kg/kWh
explanations.c: BSFC = Fuel Consumption (kg/h) / Brake Power (kW) = 0.4 kg/h / 20 kW = 0.025 kg/kWh
explanations.d: BSFC = Fuel Consumption (kg/h) / Brake Power (kW) = 0.4 kg/h / 20 kW = 0.025 kg/kWh

questions.question: How is Indicator Efficiency calculated in a single-cylinder diesel engine?

explanations.a: Indicator Efficiency is calculated as (Brake Power / Indicated Power) * 100
